bibl.title: Despatch from Samuel S. Sevier to James D. Porter, January 24, 1887
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: To the Asst Secty of State.
Settlement of the funeral expenses of the late Minister Moses A. Hopkins.
Hon. Jas. D. Porter Assistant Secretary of States Washington D.C.

Sir: I have the honor to inform you that I have this day settled the funeral expenses of the late Minster Moses A. Hopkins with G. Moove & son: and further I would inform you that I paid Rev. Thomas H. Roberts $50.00 for preaching funeral sermon according to the fill he presented.

I transmit herewith account of settlement with vouchers. The urgent demand of G. Moove & Son for payment has prevented one from waiting further insturctions according to your despatch No 13 of Sept 30 1886.
Hoping what I have done will meet the approval of the Department of State.
I have the honor to be Sir Your obedient servant
Samuel S. Sevier Acting U.S. Consul Gen.
1. Account of settlement of the funeral expenses of Moses A. Hopkins
